info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 02 at 7:14PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Cabarrus, southeastern Lincoln and northwestern Mecklenburg Counties through 800 PM EDT... At 714 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Huntersville, or near Ramsey Creek Park, moving southeast at 5 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Huntersville, Northeast Charlotte, Northwest Charlotte, Cornelius, Davidson, Charlotte Motor Speedway, Paw Creek, Ramsey Creek Park, University City and Harrisburg. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
